body_html:
I'm not sure about the train /evalname though, as I mentioned in #161 (comment) .
Maybe the following example is an exaggeration and people should first read the documentation before using something, but I can see people thinking about trying things like

model.train(dataset)
model.eval(example)
body_text:
I'm not sure about the train /evalname though, as I mentioned in #161 (comment) .
Maybe the following example is an exaggeration and people should first read the documentation before using something, but I can see people thinking about trying things like
model.train(dataset)
model.eval(example)
body:
I'm not sure about the `train` /`eval`name though, as I mentioned in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/161#issuecomment-255684092 .
Maybe the following example is an exaggeration and people should first read the documentation before using something, but I can see people thinking about trying things like

``` python
model.train(dataset)
model.eval(example)
```
